column2: LA DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.
column10: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.

column2: 2. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column6: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column8: cut abruptly in front of it.
column10: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.

column2: 3. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column8: honk to let them know you’re there.

column2: 4. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column6: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.

column2: 5. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
6. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 7. Who is most at risk?
column6: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column10: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
9. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column4: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.
column8: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.

column2: 10. Before entering a traffic circle, drivers must slow down and yield to ___________ in the traffic circle.
11. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column8: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column10: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column2: 12. Which shape is a yield sign?
13. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
14. Yellow traffic signs:
column8: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 15. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column6: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column8: turning right on red is forbidden.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
17. This warning sign:
column4: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.
column6: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column8: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column10: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.

column2: 18. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column8: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 19. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.
column6: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.
column8: sound your horn and move to the left lane.
column10: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.

column2: 20. This sign means:
21. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column8: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.

column2: 22. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 23. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
24. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column6: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column8: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column10: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.

column2: 25. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column6: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.

column2: 26. A flashing yellow light:
column6: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.
column8: warns drivers to proceed with caution.

column2: 27. Tailgating:
column6: cannot result in a traffic citation.
column10: can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.

column2: 28. Two solid yellow lines on the pavement mean:
column4: passing is allowed for both drivers.
column6: passing is allowed during daylight only.
column8: passing is allowed if you are at the top of a hill.

column2: 29. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
30. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
31. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.
column6: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column8: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.
column10: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column8: Watch for vehicles entering from the side

column2: 33. This sign means:
column6: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column8: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column10: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.

column2: 34. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
35. This road sign means:
36. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column8: when it is hard to see ahead.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
38. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column8: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column10: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 39. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
40. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column6: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column8: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column10: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
